myMath

Class Polynom

  • java.lang.Object
    • myMath.Polynom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    cont_function, function, Polynom_able

    public class Polynom
extends java.lang.Object
implements Polynom_able
    This class represents a Polynom with add, multiply functionality, it also should support the following: 1. Riemann's Integral: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riemann_integral 2. Finding a numerical value between two values (currently support root only f(x)=0). 3. Derivative
    Author:
    Boaz

      An function that get an String and convert it to an Object type Polynom.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Polynom

        public Polynom()
        the default constructor that get nothing. the constructor build an empty Polynom (as we already knows as the Zero Polynom)

      • Polynom

        public Polynom(java.lang.String Poly)
        An function that get an String and convert it to an Object type Polynom. the function will check if the string is legal and use only legal one.
        Parameters:
        flag:will - let us know if after we check if any char at String "good" is not acceptable we break the check (then in the if count will not be at size of "Poly").
        Poly: - the String that we get into the function.
        good: - is an String with all the acceptable chars for a Polynom(its will help us test if "poly" is an a "good" String.
        count - : will count every good Char we get in the String "Poly".
        PolySplit: - a array of the String "Poly" that all of them are split of the string by "+".
        PolySplitMin: - a array of the String PolySplit Strings that all of them are split of the string by "-".
        cof:represent - the coefficient of "x".
        pow:represent - the power of "x".
        temp:tempory - Monom that we will add to the new Polynom.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Polynom_able p1)
        this function will check if two Polynoms are the same one.
        Specified by:
        equals in interface Polynom_able
        Parameters:
        p1:the - Polynom that we need to check with.
        itr: - the iterator(pointer) that move over the the Polynom.
        flag: - will be true if all the Monoms of the Polynoms are the same, else will be false
        count:will - count the how much Monoms there is in p1 . if count==the original Polynom size that means that they are both at the same size.
        temp: - will hold the data that the pointer point on.
        Returns:
        true if the Polynoms are the same else false

        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • root

        public double root(double x0,
                   double x1,
                   double eps)
        this function will get x0,x1 and an epsilon will give us the root of the Polynom between them at an offset of epsilon.
        Specified by:
        root in interface Polynom_able
        Parameters:
        x0: - the first x we get in the function.
        x1:the - second x we get in the function.
        eps:the - offset we need to work by.
        mid:represent - the value of the mid point between x0,x1.
        temp: - help us to set x0 as bigger then x1.
        Returns:
        mid which represent the value of the mid point between x0,x1.

      • derivative

        public Polynom_able derivative()
        this function will take the Polynom and create an new Polynom and fill it with the derivative of the original one.
        Specified by:
        derivative in interface Polynom_able
        Parameters:
        itr: - iterator we a use to move over the our Polynom(the one who called the function).
        Poly: - the new Polynom that will hold the Original Polynom after we derivative it.
        temp: - a new Monom that will hold the data that we got from what the pointer is pointing on(the iterator).
        Returns:
        we return the new Polynom after we create it according to the derivative of the original one.

      • area

        public double area(double x0,
                   double x1,
                   double eps)
        this function will get x0,x1,eps the function will calculate the area between x0 to x1 using squares that each square is at the size of eps.
        Specified by:
        area in interface cont_function
        Specified by:
        area in interface Polynom_able
        Parameters:
        x0:the - first x (we used it as x of a point).
        x1:the - second x (same as the first one we used it as x of a point).
        eps: - the size of the squares (only width not the height).
        sumOfArea: - will hold the size of area between x0 to x1.
        numOfSquares: - an int that will hold how much squares we have.
        temp:will - hold the minimum between x0,x1.
        yTemp: - will be the y of any given x(point)
        Area: - the area of any given square according to its high and width.
        Returns:
        sumOfArea if x0!=x1 because if its is the area between them is 0.
